charitable_registration_agency: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with gross revenue under $50,000 are exempt from full Attorney General registration requirements but must still file Form CT-1 initial registration

formation_requirements.articles_of_incorporation: Required - Must include specific nonprofit language per CA Corp Code § 5130
formation_requirements.director_restrictions: Cannot be related by blood or marriage if only 3 directors
formation_requirements.registered_agent: Required - Must have California street address

requirements.description: Biennial statement filed with Secretary of State updating corporate information including current directors, officers, and addresses
requirements.filing_agency: California Secretary of State - Business Programs Division
requirements.due_date_rule: Within 90 days before the last day of the anniversary month of filing Articles of Incorporation
requirements.penalty_description: Failure to file results in suspension of corporate powers, privileges, and rights. A $250 penalty must be paid to reinstate in addition to all past-due fees.
requirements.form_name: Form SI-100 (Statement of Information - Nonprofit Corporations)
requirements.mail_filing_address: Secretary of State, Statement of Information Unit, P.O. Box 944230, Sacramento, CA 94244-2300
requirements.notes: First filing due in the calendar month that is 6 months after incorporation. Subsequent filings due every 2 years. Late filing results in suspension and $250 reinstatement fee plus past-due filing fees.
requirements.exemptions: None - ALL California nonprofit corporations must file

requirements.description: Initial registration with Attorney General Registry of Charitable Trusts required before soliciting charitable donations in California or holding assets for charitable purposes
requirements.filing_agency: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
requirements.due_date_rule: Within 30 days of receipt of initial assets or before soliciting donations, whichever occurs first
requirements.penalty_description: Operating without registration may result in cease and desist orders, civil penalties, and loss of charitable trust status
requirements.form_name: Form CT-1 (Registration Form for Charitable Corporations)
requirements.mail_filing_address: Registry of Charitable Trusts, P.O. Box 903447, Sacramento, CA 94203-4470
requirements.notes: Must be filed before accepting donations or holding charitable assets. Attach copy of IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter, Articles of Incorporation, and Bylaws.
requirements.exemptions: Religious corporations (primarily engaged in religious activities), educational institutions, hospitals, credit unions, specified government entities

requirements.description: Annual renewal of charitable solicitation registration with financial reporting to Attorney General
requirements.filing_agency: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
requirements.due_date_rule: Within 4 months and 15 days after the end of the organization's fiscal year
requirements.penalty_description: $25 late fee if filed within 30 days after due date. $50 late fee if filed more than 30 days after due date. Continued failure to file may result in suspension of charitable trust status.
requirements.form_name: Form RRF-1 (Annual Registration Renewal Fee Report)
requirements.mail_filing_address: Registry of Charitable Trusts, P.O. Box 903447, Sacramento, CA 94203-4470
requirements.notes: Must attach copy of IRS Form 990, 990-EZ, or 990-N (e-postcard confirmation). Organizations with gross revenue under $50,000 must file but are exempt from late fees.
requirements.exemptions: Organizations with gross revenue under $25,000 and no paid staff or fundraisers may file Form RRF-1 without IRS Form 990 attachment

requirements.description: Exemption from paying California sales tax on qualified purchases for the organization (not exemption from collecting sales tax)
requirements.filing_agency: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration (CDTFA)
requirements.due_date_rule: Apply after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.mail_filing_address: California Department of Tax and Fee Administration, Attn: Exempt Organization Unit, PO Box 942879, Sacramento, CA 94279-0001
requirements.notes: Provides partial exemption from sales tax on purchases for organizational use. Does NOT exempt from duty to collect sales tax when selling taxable items. Exemption applies to purchases related to charitable activities.
requirements.exemptions: Automatic for most 501(c)(3) organizations upon application

requirements.description: Exemption from property taxes for real property owned and used exclusively for religious, hospital, scientific, or charitable purposes
requirements.due_date_rule: Initial application by February 15 of fiscal year; annual claim by February 15 each year to maintain exemption
requirements.penalty_description: Failure to file annual claim results in loss of exemption and retroactive property tax assessment
requirements.mail_filing_address: File with local County Assessor's Office
requirements.notes: Property must be used EXCLUSIVELY for qualifying purposes. Mixed-use property may receive partial exemption. Must also file BOE-267-L (Organizational Clearance Certificate) with State Board of Equalization for initial approval. Annual claim must be filed EVERY YEAR to maintain exemption.
requirements.exemptions: Must be 501(c)(3) and property must be used exclusively for charitable purposes

requirements.description: Annual registration with Attorney General required to conduct raffles as fundraising activity
requirements.filing_agency: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
requirements.due_date_rule: At least 90 days before conducting first raffle of calendar year
requirements.penalty_description: Conducting raffles without registration is illegal gambling under California Penal Code and may result in criminal prosecution
requirements.mail_filing_address: Registry of Charitable Trusts, P.O. Box 903447, Sacramento, CA 94203-4470
requirements.notes: Organization must be registered with Registry of Charitable Trusts for at least ONE YEAR before conducting raffles. Maximum prize value per raffle: $250,000. Maximum 20 raffles per calendar year. Must file Form CT-NRP-1 within 10 days after each raffle. Tickets must be sold in California only.
requirements.exemptions: Must be 501(c)(3) registered with CA AG for 1+ years
related_forms: CT-NRP-1 (Notice of Raffle - filed after each raffle)

requirements.description: Registration required if organization contracts with commercial fundraiser for professional solicitation or fundraising counsel
requirements.filing_agency: California Attorney General - Registry of Charitable Trusts
requirements.due_date_rule: Before commencing fundraising activities; annual renewal by January 31
requirements.penalty_description: Contracting with unregistered fundraiser may void contract and result in liability
requirements.form_name: Form CT-CFR-1 (Charity Fundraising Commercial Contract Filing)
requirements.mail_filing_address: Registry of Charitable Trusts, P.O. Box 903447, Sacramento, CA 94203-4470
requirements.notes: Required ONLY if organization contracts with commercial fundraiser (paid professional). Written contract must be filed with AG within 10 days of execution. Fundraiser must also register separately with AG. NOT required if only using volunteers.
requirements.exemptions: Not required if only using volunteers or internal staff

requirements.description: Organizations with gross revenue of $2 million or more must have an independent financial audit by a CPA
requirements.filing_agency: Self-enforced; audit report filed with AG on RRF-1
requirements.due_date_rule: Complete audit within 9 months after fiscal year end; file with RRF-1
requirements.penalty_description: Failure to conduct required audit is violation of charity registration requirements
requirements.notes: Audit must be conducted by independent CPA licensed in California. Organizations with revenue between $2M-$10M may have audit or review. Organizations with revenue $10M+ must have full audit. Audit report must accompany RRF-1 filing.
requirements.exemptions: Organizations with gross revenue under $2 million

special_notes.audit_requirements: Organizations with $2M+ revenue must have independent audit; $10M+ must have full audit (not just review)
special_notes.public_disclosure: IRS Form 990 and CA Form RRF-1 are public records and must be made available for inspection
special_notes.board_requirements: Minimum 3 directors required; if only 3 directors, cannot be related by blood or marriage
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to another 501(c)(3) organization or government entity for public purposes
special_notes.political_activity: 501(c)(3) organizations may engage in limited lobbying (may elect 501(h) for higher limits) but NO candidate endorsements or campaign contributions
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Must file Form 109 (California Exempt Organization Business Income Tax Return) if gross receipts from unrelated business exceed $1,000
special_notes.workers_compensation: Must carry workers' compensation insurance if any employees
special_notes.unemployment_insurance: Must register with EDD if any employees subject to California unemployment insurance
special_notes.minimum_wage: California minimum wage applies to nonprofit employees (currently $16.00/hour as of 2024)
special_notes.sexual_harassment_training: Organizations with 5+ employees must provide sexual harassment prevention training
